text: The National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) is an independent federal agency of the U.S. government. It was created by the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965 (). It was created to support research, education, preservation, and public programs in the humanities. The NEH is housed at 400 7th St SW, Washington, D.C. From 1979 to 2014, NEH was at 1100 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. in the Nancy Hanks Center at the Old Post Office. ==List of Chairpersons== * Barnaby Keeney, 1963-1965, Chair of National Commission on the Humanities * Henry Allen Moe, 1965-66, Interim Chair * Barnaby Keeney, 1966-1970 * Wallace Edgerton, Acting Chair, 1970-71 * Ronald Berman, 1971-1977 * Robert Kingston, Acting Chair, 1977 * Joseph Duffey, 1977-81 * William J.
